title: Proclamation Celebrating the 160th Anniversary of the Establishment of the United States Secret Service
summary: This proclamation commemorates the 160th anniversary of the establishment of the United States Secret Service, which was created on April 14, 1865, by President Abraham Lincoln. The agency was initially founded to combat counterfeiting of U.S. currency and has since expanded its responsibilities to include protecting the President, Vice President, and other designated individuals, as well as investigating financial crimes. The proclamation highlights the historical significance and ongoing mission of the Secret Service.
